meanings.def: used at the beginning of a letter before the name or title of the person that you are writing to
examples: Dear Sir or Madam
Dear Mrs Jones
Dear Beth/Dad/Aunt Susan
(old-fashioned) My dear sister

meanings.def: loved by or important to somebody
examples: He's one of my dearest friends.
They are grieving over their dear departed ones.
dear to somebody Her daughter is very dear to her.
They lost everything that was dear to them.
Kate is a very dear friend of mine.
Congratulations, my dear!
The team is responsible for conserving red deer in the forest.

meanings.def: used in speech or writing to address somebody in a polite or friendly way
examples: Martin, my dear fellow…
Take my advice, dear reader.

meanings.def: expensive; costing a lot of money
examples: Everything's so dear now, isn't it?
There was a shortage of potatoes, and they became dear.

meanings.def: having a lot of importance and interest for somebody
used to describe somebody in a way that shows love
examples: Dear old Sue! I knew she'd help.
Their baby's a dear little thing.
It's always good to hear from dear old Harry!

meanings.def: as hard or as fast as possible
examples: She was holding on to the rope for dear life.
Run for your life!

meanings.def: to hold somebody/something very tightly because you are afraid
to care very much for somebody/something; to value somebody/something highly
examples: He had destroyed everything we held dear.

idioms.def: having a lot of importance and interest for somebody
used to describe somebody in a way that shows love
examples: Dear old Sue! I knew she'd help.
Their baby's a dear little thing.
It's always good to hear from dear old Harry!

idioms.idiom: for dear life | for your life
idioms.def: as hard or as fast as possible
examples: She was holding on to the rope for dear life.
Run for your life!

idioms.def: to hold somebody/something very tightly because you are afraid
to care very much for somebody/something; to value somebody/something highly
examples: He had destroyed everything we held dear.

meanings.def: used in expressions that show that you are surprised, upset, annoyed or worried
examples: Oh dear! I think I've lost my purse!
Oh dear! What a shame.
Dear me! What a mess!
Dear oh dear! What are you going to do now?
Isn't he a dear?
Be a dear and fetch me my coat.

meanings.def: used when speaking to somebody you love
examples: Would you like a drink, dear?
Come here, my dear.
Kate is a very dear friend of mine.
Congratulations, my dear!
The team is responsible for conserving red deer in the forest.

meanings.def: used when speaking to somebody in a friendly way, for example by an older person to a young person or a child
examples: What's your name, dear?
to buy cheap and sell dear

meanings.def: to cost somebody a lot of money
examples: The campaign for the presidency has cost him dear.

meanings.def: to make somebody suffer a lot
examples: That one mistake has cost him dear over the years.

idioms.def: to cost somebody a lot of money
examples: The campaign for the presidency has cost him dear.
That one mistake has cost him dear over the years.
